paper.title: A portfolio of classification problems by one-dimensional cellular automata, over cyclic binary configurations and parallel update
paper.abstract: Decision problems addressed by cellular automata have been historically expressed either as determining whether initial configurations would belong to a given language, or as classifying the initial configurations according to a property in them. Unlike traditional approaches in language recognition, classification problems have typically relied upon cyclic configurations and fully paralell (two-way) update of the cells, which render the action of the cellular automaton relatively less controllable and difficult to analyse. Although the notion of cyclic languages have been studied in the wider realm of formal languages, only recently a more systematic attempt has come into play in respect to cellular automata with fully parallel update. With the goal of contributing to this effort, we propose a unified definition of classification problem for one-dimensional, binary cellular automata, from which various known problems are couched in and novel ones are defined, and analyse the solvability of the new problems. Such a unified perspective aims at increasing existing knowledge about classification problems by cellular automata over cyclic configurations and parallel update.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究一维细胞自动机在循环二进制配置和并行更新下的分类问题，属于计算机科学和数学领域，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域的具体应用。
